private_information: I want to meet as many friends as possible during the day
I can travel from Bayview to Pacific Heights in 23 minutes and return in 22 minutes
traveler.goal: Maximize the number of friends met today while ensuring a meeting with Thomas of at least 105 minutes

private_information: I will be at Pacific Heights from 12:15 to 17:15
I can meet for a minimum of 105 minutes during that window
thomas.goal: Be available to meet the traveler in Pacific Heights for at least 105 minutes between 12:15 and 17:15

orchestrator.goal: Integrate candidate schedules and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that maximizes friends met and enforces Thomas meeting constraints

public_information: Travel time Bayview to Pacific Heights is 23 minutes
Travel time Pacific Heights to Bayview is 22 minutes
Thomas is at Pacific Heights from 12:15 to 17:15
You must meet Thomas for at least 105 minutes during Thomas availability window

itineraries.system_prompt: You are an assistant that generates candidate itineraries for a single day given public and private information. Provide multiple feasible schedules including locations and time intervals, travel segments and arrival/departure times. Do not emit PDDL. Focus on candidate schedules and timing details only.
itineraries.prompt: Your name is traveler. Use the public information from the environment and your private information to produce candidate daily itineraries that attempt to maximize meetings while respecting travel times and personal constraints. Provide several distinct options with explicit timestamps, locations, and meeting durations. If information is missing, do not assume additional constraints; present options based on the information you have.

itineraries.system_prompt: You are an assistant that provides availability constraints and preferred meeting details for the friend Thomas. Describe available time windows, location constraints, and minimum acceptable meeting durations. Do not emit PDDL.
itineraries.prompt: Your name is thomas. Provide precise availability information and any constraints relevant to meeting the traveler. State the available time window, location, and minimum meeting length. Provide any flexibility or hard constraints you have. Do not assume additional availability outside what you specify.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL. Your task is to integrate candidate schedules and availability constraints from the agents and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem tailored for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and roles of different agents distinct where applicable. Ensure the PDDL encodes travel durations, time windows, and the requirement that Thomas is met for at least 105 minutes. Target FastDownwards compatibility in the domain and problem modeling.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive candidate itineraries from the traveler and availability information from Thomas. Integrate these inputs and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode locations, travel durations, time progression or temporal constraints appropriate for FastDownwards, and an objective that maximizes the number of friends met while enforcing a meeting with Thomas of at least 105 minutes during his availability window. Use the following sources of information: environment public information: {environment->public_information} traveler proposals: {traveler_options} Thomas availability and constraints: {thomas_options} Think step by step and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
